paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Breast cancer, rectal cancer, colon cancer

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Carriers were significantly more likely to have breast cancer than non-carriers (p = 8e−06), with 50% of carriers having breast cancer across four unrelated families.
Four patients carrying BRCA2 variants had rectal cancer.

functional_data.summary: All PVs observed within BRCA2 were deletion or duplication events which significantly disrupt gene function.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, appeared only in cancer patients and high-risk patients.
variants.additional_notes: The most frequent BRCA2 variant in this sample was the previously considered VUS c.122C>T, although carriers with cancer did not report breast cancer.
key_quotes: All PVs observed within BRCA2 were deletion or duplication events which significantly disrupt gene function.
Carriers were significantly more likely to have breast cancer than non-carriers (p = 8e−06), with 50% of carriers having breast cancer across four unrelated families.
